meanings.definition: To mix with a circular or back-and-forth motion.
meanings.sent1: She used a spoon to stir the soup.
meanings.sent2: Please stir the paint before using it.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to stir the milk with its paw.
meanings.sent4: His speech stirred the audience to action.
meanings.sent5: The wind will stir the leaves on the ground.

meanings.sent1: He felt a slight stir in the bushes.
meanings.sent2: The curtains began to stir in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The quiet room suddenly felt a stir of excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her words stirred something deep within him.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her laughter would always stir his heart.

meanings.sent1: I noticed a small stir in the water.
meanings.sent2: The sudden stir in the bushes caught my attention.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected stir in the room made everyone look around.
meanings.sent4: A stir of anticipation filled the air before the announcement.
meanings.sent5: The stir of the leaves in the wind created a soothing sound.
